comment.text: This translation key is used for the text displayed on a cancel button. It's intended to be translated and will appear as the label of a "Cancel" button in certain UI elements.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'إلغاء نص الزر' literally translates to 'Cancel text of the button'. While understandable, it's not the most natural or idiomatic way to express 'Cancel button text' in Arabic. It would be better to convey the meaning as 'نص زر الإلغاء' or 'نص زر الرجاء'.

The translation "Düymə mətnini ləğv edin" is a literal translation of "Cancel button text" and doesn't convey the meaning of the text that should appear on a cancel button. It translates to 'Cancel button text'. The intended meaning is 'Cancel'.

The translation 'Text der Abbrechen-Schaltfläche' is a literal translation but not the most natural phrasing in German. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Abbrechen-Text' or 'Text für die Abbrechen-Schaltfläche'.
The translation 'Cancelar el texto de botones' is a literal translation and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Cancel button text'. It translates to 'Cancel the text of buttons'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be 'Texto del botón Cancelar' or 'Texto para el botón Cancelar'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Peruuta painikkeen teksti' is too literal. A more natural Finnish translation for 'Cancel button text' would be 'Peruuta' or 'Kumoaa'. Including 'painikkeen teksti' is redundant as it's implied.

The French translation 'Supprimer le texte du bouton' literally translates to 'Delete button text'. It doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Cancel button text', which implies the text that should appear on a cancel button. A more appropriate translation would be 'Texte du bouton Annuler' or 'Texte pour le bouton Annuler'.

The translation 'Չեղարկել կոճակի տեքստը' literally translates to 'Cancel button text'. While technically correct, it's overly literal and reads awkwardly in Armenian. A more natural phrasing would be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Չեղարկման գամմաժողվրդավարությունը' or 'Չեղարկելու գամմաժողվրդավարությունը'. Alternatively, a simplified 'Չեղարկել' might suffice, depending on the UI context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Italian translation 'Annulla il testo del pulsante' literally translates to 'Cancel the button text'. This is not the intended meaning. The phrase refers to the text *on* the cancel button, not the act of canceling the text itself.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The correct translation should be something like 'Testo del pulsante Annulla' or 'Testo del pulsante di annullamento'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation "버튼 텍스트 취소" literally translates to "button text cancel". It doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "Cancel button text". It lacks the possessive element and the intended meaning is the text *on* the cancel button.

The translation 'ຍົກເລີກຂໍ້ຄວາມປຸ່ມ' literally translates to 'Cancel text button'. It's not the most natural or idiomatic way to express 'Cancel button text' in Lao. A more accurate and natural translation would be something like 'ຕົວຢ່າງຄຳນະຳປຸ່ມຍົກເລີກ' or 'ຂໍ້ຄວາມປຸ່ມຍົກເລີກ'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ຕົວຢ່າງຄຳນະຳປຸ່ມຍົກເລີກ' or 'ຂໍ້ຄວາມປຸ່ມຍົກເລີກ'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Annuleren knop tekst' is a literal translation of 'Cancel button text' but doesn't flow naturally in Dutch. A more idiomatic translation would be more appropriate.

The translation 'Anulare text buton' is not the best representation of 'Cancel button text'. A more natural Romanian translation would be 'Text buton Anulare' or 'Text pentru butonul Anulare'. The current translation is a literal translation, but sounds awkward in Romanian.
The translation 'අවලංගු බොත්තමේ පෙළ' literally translates to 'Invalid button text'. The correct meaning of 'Cancel button text' should convey a button used to cancel an action.
The translation 'Zrušiť text tlačidla' is a literal translation of 'Cancel button text' and is not idiomatic Slovak. It translates to 'Cancel text button'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural Slovak translation would be 'Text tlačidla zrušiť' or 'Text pre tlačidlo Zrušiť'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'Besedilo gumba za preklic' is a very literal and slightly awkward translation. A more natural Slovenian phrasing would be preferred.
The translation "Откажи текст дугмета" is not a natural or accurate translation of "Cancel button text." It literally translates to "Reject text button," which doesn't convey the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be something like "Текст за дугме 'Откажи'" or "Текст на дугме 'Откажи'" (Text for 'Cancel' button / Text on 'Cancel' button).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Otkaži tekst dugmeta" literally translates to "Cancel text of the button." It doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "Cancel button text." The intended meaning is the text that appears on the cancel button.
The translation "Xóa chữ cho nút" is not an accurate translation of "Cancel button text". It literally translates to "Delete text for button" which doesn't convey the meaning of a cancel button.

The translation '取消按钮文字' is too literal. While technically correct, it sounds awkward in Chinese.  '取消按钮文字' directly translates to 'Cancel button text,' which is redundant.  A more natural translation would focus on the *function* of the button, not its label.
